column4: I am using a Brother-HL-5250DN with Ubuntu 11.10 and not able to print at all, any reason why?
does your printer show up in System>Administration>Printing ?
does your printer appear in the print dialog from an application (like gedit)?
yes but says unable to locate printer
it's a different model printer, but same make.  See if it helps you: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1662061
I am using the old desktop so I might not have the same printer program.  I am not sure how to edit the settings of the printer
there is only applications and places and no other menu
when I asked you if the printer showed up in the System>Administration>Printing dialog, how did you pull it up?
Applications > System Tools > System Settings (Click Printers)
from inside there, right-click the printer and click Properties.  (I don't have the latest release, so this might not work, but give it a try for me.)
no menu showing up when I do that
sorry then, I don't know enough about the new release to help you further.  Ask again in a few minutes and maybe someone else will be more informed.
I am just using the classic desktop
The classic desktop is similar but not identical.  I can't help you further since I don't know how properties are adjusted in the new version.
I am using CUPS if that helps, and the connection says: dnssd://Brother%20HL-5250DN%20series._pdl-datastream._tcp.local/
